verses.roman:
bāhire phukāre loka, darśana nā pāñā
'kṛṣṇa kaha' balena prabhu bāhire āsiyā

synonyms: bāhire—outside; phu-kāre—with a tumultuous sound; loka—people; darśana nā pāñā—not being able to see; kṛṣṇa kaha—chant Kṛṣṇa; balena—says; prabhu—Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; bāhire āsiyā—coming outside.
translation: Being unable to see Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu, the populace outside His room would make a tumultuous sound. Thus Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu would go outside and tell them,"Chant Hare Kṛṣṇa."
